learning_outcomes.description: Explain and interpret concepts in analytic and algebraic number theory
Solve problems and prove results in analytic and algebraic number theory
Evaluate important ideas in the field of abstract algebra
Solve problems and prove results in abstract algebra

assessments.task_description:
In the In-Semester Quiz, students will be asked to answer questions on the material covered in the first 6 weeks of lectures.

Students who miss the Quiz have to do an oral in-semester test instead, covering the same material.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Students are expected to write a 10-page report on a topic in algebra & representation theory and give a 20-minute talk on their report. 

All talks will be held in the final three weeks of semester.

The report will be worth 20% and the talk 20% for a combined 40%.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Gradescope will be used for the submission of the reports
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 1 grade for each 24 hour period from time submission is due will apply for up to 7 days. After 7 days you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date: Exam week 1 Mon - Exam week 2 Fri
assessments.task_description:
There will be a 45-minute oral final exam.

Students may use the board, or pen and paper, to assist in answering questions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Lectures

Students are expected to attend lectures in person and have completed the homework problems.
learning_activities.topic_description: Lectures Students are expected to attend lectures in person and have completed the homework problems.
